message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s lab results indicate acute kidney injury with hyperkalemia and hyperuricemia, which can be caused by tumor lysis syndrome (TLS) after starting chemotherapy. Hemodialysis is the most effective therapy for metabolic abnormalities in TLS. Saline with mannitol helps prevent TLS, allopurinol helps prevent uric acid accumulation but doesn’t treat acute hyperuricemia, and rasburicase is contraindicated in patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency, which is common in patients with AIDS.

Hemodialysis is the most effective way to manage severe electrolyte abnormalities associated with TLS, especially in this patient with pre-existing kidney issues. Intravenous saline with mannitol helps increase urine output but doesn't address the underlying issue of TLS. Allopurinol and intravenous rasburicase are used for prophylaxis or treatment of TLS, but are not effective for severe cases like this patient.
